date: 5/4/20
output: html_notebook
---

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(lubridate)
```

Type any R code in the chunk, for example:
```{r}
stocks = read.csv('./history.csv') %>%
  group_by(Name) %>%
  mutate(Seconds_Epoch=Second+(Minute*60)+(Hour*3600)+(Day*86400)+(Year*31536000)) %>%
  arrange(Seconds_Epoch) # %>%
  # mutate(dT=)
stocks %>% ggplot(aes(x=Seconds_Epoch, y=Bid_Price)) + facet_wrap(~Name, scales='free') + geom_point() + geom_smooth() + labs(x='Time (sec)', y='Bid Price')
```

Now, click the **Run** button on the chunk toolbar to [execute](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/pycharm/r-markdown.html#run-r-code) the chunk code. The result should be placed under the chunk.
Click the **Knit and Open Document** to built and preview an output.
